Why am I getting the error "Could not run curl-config: [Errno 2] No such file or directory" while trying to install pycurl using the command "sudo pip install pycurl"? Here is the traceback I get after running the setup.py:

```
Downloading/unpacking pycurl
  Running setup.py egg_info for package pycurl
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "<string>", line 16, in <module>
      File "/tmp/pip-build-root/pycurl/setup.py", line 563, in <module>
        ext = get_extension()
      File "/tmp/pip-build-root/pycurl/setup.py", line 368, in get_extension
        ext_config = ExtensionConfiguration()
      File "/tmp/pip-build-root/pycurl/setup.py", line 65, in __init__
        self.configure()
      File "/tmp/pip-build-root/pycurl/setup.py", line 100, in configure_unix
        raise ConfigurationError(msg)
    __main__.ConfigurationError: Could not run curl-config: [Errno 2] No such file or directory
    Complete output from command python setup.py egg_info:
    Traceback (most recent call last):

  File "<string>", line 16, in <module>

  File "/tmp/pip-build-root/pycurl/setup.py", line 563, in <module>

    ext = get_extension()

  File "/tmp/pip-build-root/pycurl/setup.py", line 368, in get_extension

    ext_config = ExtensionConfiguration()

  File "/tmp/pip-build-root/pycurl/setup.py", line 65, in __init__

    self.configure()

  File "/tmp/pip-build-root/pycurl/setup.py", line 100, in configure_unix

    raise ConfigurationError(msg)

__main__.ConfigurationError: Could not run curl-config: [Errno 2] No such file or directory
```
How can I resolve this issue?

The error message you're encountering indicates that the `curl-config` script is not found on your system. This script is part of the development package for the `libcurl` library, which is required for building the `pycurl` Python module.

To resolve this issue, you need to install the development package for `libcurl`. Here's how you can do it depending on your operating system:

### On Ubuntu/Debian:

You can install the `libcurl` development package using the following command:

```bash
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install libcurl4-openssl-dev
```

### On CentOS/RHEL:

You can install the `libcurl` development package using the following command:

```bash
sudo yum install libcurl-devel
```

### On macOS:

If you are using Homebrew, you can install `curl` with:

```bash
brew install curl
```

You might also need to link the package or ensure that Homebrew's `curl` is being used, so you can try:

```bash
brew link --force curl
```

Once you have installed the appropriate package for your operating system, try running the `pip install pycurl` command again:

```bash
sudo pip install pycurl
```

This should resolve the error and allow you to successfully install the `pycurl` module.
